p: Long forgotten but deserving of mention is a major polio vaccine disaster that occurred in the wake of Salk’s discovery. Right after the Pittsburgh Press proclaimed on April 12, 1955, “ Polio is Conquered” and the uniform “canonization of Jonas Salk” [ 15], patients contracted poliomyelitis soon after receiving a vaccine from Cutter Laboratories of Berkeley, California. Instead of an inactivated virus, the vaccine contained live polio virus. Failure to ensure the inactivation process (also summarized as “multiple synergistic failures”) led to a resurgence of cases [ 16]. While paralysis was often limited to the limb receiving the injection, it still caused deaths. Over 200 cases of paralytic illness occurred before it was withdrawn from the market. Although the company was not found liable, the episode led to federal regulation of vaccines.
